required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety and Tolerability of sc Immunotherapy With DM-101 in Adults With Birch Pollen Allergy
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Dose Escalation Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Subcutaneous Immunotherapy With DM-101 in Adults With Birch Pollen Allergy

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized, double-blind placebo-controlled phase I study to investigate the safety and tolerability of ascending doses of DM-101 in adult subjects with birch pollen allergy.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be carried out in a single study site located in Finland.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 6 sequential study cohorts with ascending DM-101 doses. In each cohort two treatment arms: placebo and active drug

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose until 28 days following the last dose.
primary_outcome.description: Number of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose until 28 days following the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Number and severity of systemic allergic reactions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose until 28 days following the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Number and severity of local injection site reactions

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects reaching the pre-defined DM-101 dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose until 28 days following the last dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects reaching the pre-defined, admissible dose in each DM-101 dosing group

arm_group.description: Cohort 1 randomized in 2:1 will receive a single s.c. dose of DM-101 or matching placebo
Cohort 2 randomized in 3:1 will receive multiple ascending s.c. doses of DM-101 or matching placebo during 5 biweekly dosing occasions
Cohort 3 randomized in 3:1 will receive multiple ascending s.c. doses of DM-101 or matching placebo during 5 biweekly dosing occasions
Group 4 randomized in 3:1 will receive multiple ascending s.c. doses of DM-101 or matching placebo during 5 biweekly dosing occasions
Cohort 5 randomized in 3:1 will receive multiple ascending s.c. doses of DM-101 or matching placebo during 5 biweekly dosing occasions
Cohort 6 randomized in 3:1 will receive multiple ascending s.c. doses of DM-101 or matching placebo during 5 biweekly dosing occasions

intervention.description: Ascending DM-101 doses in each cohort

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Males or females, aged 18 to 65 years
- Good general health
- A documented clinical history of birch pollen-induced allergic rhinitis or rhinoconjunctivitis with symptoms that interfere with daily activities or sleep and remain bothersome despite the use of relevant symptomatic medication, and have been present over, at least, 2 allergy seasons.
- Bet v 1 specific serum IgE ≥ 0.7 kU/L
- Positive SPT to birch pollen allergen, with a wheal diameter ≥ 5 mm
- Body weight ≥50 kg and body mass index (BMI) within the range 18-35 kg/m2.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History or findings on physical examination of any significant disease or disorder which, in the opinion of the Investigator, may put the subject at risk because of participation in the study, influence the results of the study or the subject's ability to participate in the study.
- Current diagnosis of asthma (other than seasonal during the birch pollen allergy season), requiring Global Initiative for Asthma (GINA) Step 2 or higher treatment, or asthma partially controlled or uncontrolled according to GINA classification in the 6 months before Screening.
- History of asthma deterioration that resulted in emergency treatment or hospitalisation in the 12 months before screening, or a life-threatening asthma attack at any time in the past.
- Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) < 70% of predicted, regardless of asthma status at screening or baseline assessment at the first dosing visit.
- History of severe drug allergy, severe angioedema or systemic allergic reaction of Grade 3 or greater, according to the World Allergy Organization (WAO) scale, due to any cause.

patient_data.ipd_description: All individual participant data that underlie publicly available results will be considered for sharing
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Anonymized participant data will be considered for sharing once the indication has been approved by a regulatory body, if there is legal authority to share the data and there is not a reasonable likelihood of participant re-identification.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Qualified researchers may request access to patient level data and related study documents. Patient level data will be anonymized and study documents will be redacted to protect the privacy of trial participants. Patient level data will be anonymized and study documents will be redacted to protect the privacy of trial participants after Desentum has received marketing authorization from major health authorities (e.g., FDA, EMA), has the legal authority to share the data, and has made the study results publicly available.
